title: Understanding spontaneity
text: To determine if a reaction is spontaneous at a given temperature, you need to look at the sign of ∆G° (Gibbs free energy change). If ∆G° is negative, the reaction is spontaneous.

title: What does a negative ∆G° indicate?
text: Given that ∆G° is $$-394.4$$ $$\frac{kJ}{mol}$$ for the reaction, what does this tell us about the spontaneity of the reaction at $$298$$ K?
